nz.govt.natlib.meta.harvester

Class NLNZHarvester

  • java.lang.Object
    • nz.govt.natlib.meta.Harvester
      • nz.govt.natlib.meta.harvester.NLNZHarvester
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ProgressStopListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BasicHarvester

    public class NLNZHarvester
extends Harvester
    Harvests Objects in the NLNZ Data Dictionary Schema format. NOTE: Delegate pattern! Because a decision needs to be made about what the harvester really is supposed to harvest and the calling interface does not know how to make that desision - nor should it, it should be generic.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    unascribed

    • Method Detail

      • getOutputType

        public java.lang.String getOutputType()
        Description copied from class: Harvester
        Returns the DTD file that the output metadata files will conform to. For the Harvester to complete successfully, there must be a mapping that converts files from their default DTD to the DTD returned by this method. For example, the GIFAdapter produces output in the gif.dtd format. If the Harvester produces output in the format MyMetaData.dtd, then there must be a mapping XSLT that converts from gif.dtd to MyMetaData.dtd. The output type does not technically need to be a DTD, but you must create an XSLT mapping to whatever output type you choose.
        Specified by:
        getOutputType in class Harvester
        Returns:
        The name of the target output type.

           ProgressListener listener)
             throws java.io.IOException
        The main method decides which harvester to use based on some inside info about the source... The delegate then goes on to do the work on behalf of this class.
        Specified by:

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Description copied from class: Harvester
        Signal the harvester to stop. The harvester may not stop immediately, but should stop as soon as possible.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface ProgressStopListener
        Overrides:
